Class DatabaseHandler

extends Object
implements Database
    Created at 25/02/2019
    Author:
    Luke Bingham

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean cachePreparedStatements
      Should the connection cache prepared statements
      protected String connectionTestQuery
      The ping alive query
      protected int connectionTimeoutMs
      How long, in millis, we stop waiting for new connection (15 secs)
      protected int idleTimeoutMs
      How long, in millis, before connections timeout (45 secs)
      protected int leakDetectionThresholdMs
      How long, in millis, can a connection be gone from a pool (4 secs)
      protected PrintWriter logWriter
      The log writer for Hikari
      protected int maxLifetimeMs
      How long, in millis, this connection can be alive for (30 mins)
      protected int maxPoolSize
      How many max connections should exist in pool (2)
      protected int maxPreparedStatementCache
      Max number of prepared statements to have
      protected int minIdle
      How many minimum idle connections should we always have (2)
      protected int preparedStatementCache
      Number of prepared statements to cache per connection

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(DatabaseCredentials dbCreds,
                 String driver)
        Initialize the handler with the specified database credentials.

        Sets up the configuration for the connection pool and conf settings.

        Parameters:
        dbCreds - - the credentials for the database
        driver - - the driver class

      • init

        protected void init(DatabaseCredentials credentials)
        Initialize the database handler given the credentials.
        Parameters:
        credentials - - the login details to this database

      • init

        public void init(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin,
                 String path)
        Load the settings for HikariCP from the plugin config and stores them locally in the object, then initializes the database handler.
        Parameters:
        plugin - - the owning plugin
        path - - the path to load settings from

      • init

        public void init(org.bukkit.configuration.file.YamlConfiguration config)
        Load the settings for HikariCP from the yaml config and stores them locally in the object, then initializes the database handler.
        Parameters:
        config - - the yaml configuration

      • init

        Parameters:
        config - - the yaml configuration

      • close

        public void close()
        Close HikariCP connection pool, and all the connections.

        Note: This should be called whenever the plugin turns off!
